task.title: Remove a drive from the cluster
task.shortdesc: The SolidFire system puts a drive in a failed state if the drive's self-diagnostics tells the node it has failed or if communication with the drive stops for five and a half minutes or longer. The system displays a list of the failed drives. You must remove a failed drive from the failed drive list in NetApp Element software.

step.cmd: In the Element UI, click ClusterDrives.
Click Failed to view the list of failed drives.
Note the slot number of the failed drive.
step.info: You need this information to locate the failed drive in the chassis.

step.cmd: Remove the failed drive using one of the following methods:

ol.li: Click Actions for the drive you want to remove.
Select all the drives you want to remove, and click Bulk Actions.

step.info: After you remove the failed drive from the cluster, you can remove and replace the drive from the chassis.
